# handleSetStateByIndices | Apple Developer Documentation

- [ DriverKit ](/documentation/driverkit)

- [ IOStateReporter_IVars ](/documentation/driverkit/iostatereporter_ivars)

- [ handleSetStateByIndices ](/documentation/driverkit/iostatereporter_ivars/handlesetstatebyindices)

- [ IOStateReporter_IVars ](/documentation/driverkit/iostatereporter_ivars)

-  handleSetStateByIndices 

Instance Method# handleSetStateByIndices

DriverKitiOSiPadOSmacOS

```
IOReturn handleSetStateByIndices(int channel_index, int new_state_index, uint64_t last_intransition, uint64_t prev_state_residency);
```

## [ Parameters ](/documentation/driverkit/iostatereporter_ivars/handlesetstatebyindices#parameters)

`channel_index`
- 0.., available from getChannelIndex()

`new_state_index`
- New state for the channel

`last_intransition`
- to remove: time of most recent entry

`prev_state_residency`
- to remove: time spent in previous state

## [Return Value](/documentation/driverkit/iostatereporter_ivars/handlesetstatebyindices#return-value)

Appropriate IOReturn code

## [Discussion](/documentation/driverkit/iostatereporter_ivars/handlesetstatebyindices#discussion)

Update a channel state without validating channel_id

Locked version of IOReporter::setStateByIndices(). This method may be overriden by sub-classes.

Locking: Caller must ensure that the reporter (data) lock is held.
